page.title: 09WORSBROUGH MILL MUSEUM
page.content: The mill in Worsbrough is a{corn {mill.}It was built in two parts.The first part was water powered.It was built around{1625}.In the early 19th century a second part to the mill was built.This was powered by a{steam {engine}.They built it because the demand for flour increased as the population grew. Demand for flour from local mills declined and the building fell into disrepair. It was{taken over in 1974}by South Yorkshire County Council, restored and opened as a{working museum}. Many visitors come to see the working water powered mill and the early oil fired engine which now powers the machinery in the new mill.
